description: I'm a big fan of good colors out of the box. Terminology gives more options than gnome-terminal, and is a lot more attractive. I've had some minor issues with not being able to customize it enough (circa Jessie 8 in 2016). But it is more than good enough to replace gnome-terminal as my default term.
summary: Great terminal emulator with fancy features

description:
I am back on a computer after almost 20 years. Just when I started forming a scathing view of the state
of afairs, comes along this package.
It is throughly beautiful, has and does any and every thing one could want from this type of program.
All I am wishing for here, are more classic tools, thoroughly modernized in exactly this manner.
About when will this be updated to 1.9.0 version?
Enjoying this alternative to standard ones

You can split a single terminal window into several terminals - my favorite is to first split vertically so that there is a left and right pane, then to split the left pane horiztonally so that there is a 1) Top Left, 2) Bottom Left, and 3) Right pane - all within a single window (as opposed to tabs or new windows).

Beyond that there's a multitude of options from setting your fonts, to how to handle images, links, drag and drop, etc. I know there is another good emulator out there but Terminology is my goto and one of the first things I install when I reload Debian. 

The only downside I can see is that you can't set Terminology to wholly replace gnome-terminal with regards to the Nautilus (gnome file explorer) context menu option.

best terminal, it supports neofetch images, it has beautiful themes, like the nyan cat one etctere, its so 
customizable
ok it help for clear view o files
Crashes on fresh install of ubuntu 12.04
It is easy to split screens and use tabs, something I was missing in other terminal applications.

This is a great Terminal app. Someone below commented recently it crashed on ubuntu 12, but we're up to ubuntu 20 (or at least 18) now! Have used this on multiple computers and works well. I had one install issue and jumped on IRC and the developer helped me track things down. Right click to change theme/fontsize. My favorite is being able to preview images right inside the terminal. tyls shows thumbnails of all images in a directory. or tycat filename.jpg shows a fullsize image right inside the terminal.
summary: Great Terminal app. My fave and I use it daily

description: thank you so much, i needed this in my life! i will contribute asap!
summary: perfect for a n00b like me!

description: Me encanta visualmente. Se puede configurar de muchas formas.
Soporta imágenes y tiene muchas opciones de configuración

Could be cool, but not enough customizable. The worse is the impossibility to change the default editor.
Also term allows to clic on files to open them, but this only work after "find", not after ls for example. Too bad
Весь рабочий процесс в терминале стал похож на игру.
